c74object.name: mvc.remote
c74object.digest: Monitor and remote control values from an mvc.parameter, mvc.state and mvc.message, .
c74object.description: mvc.remote allows to bind to a component's input for remote control or monitoring. This can either be a mvc.parameter, an mvc.state or an mvc.message. The address it refers to can be set dynamically and multiple addresses can be provided, either as a list or through brace expansion notation and wildcards. The mvc.remote object helps implementing the view and controller part in the MVC model used in the MVC package.

inlet.digest: Messages to set the values (see below)

outlet.digest: Monitored address with index in the mvc.remote namespace (see below)

objarg.name: address
objarg.description: The address of the monitored mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message should be expressed with slash-separated symbols (Ã la OSC).

method.name: anything (on the left inlet)
method.digest: Feed values to mvc.remote (on the left inlet).
method.description: The values fed to the left inlet will be sent to all addresses covered by the mvc.remote namespace, provided a matching mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message address exists.

method.name: setvalue (on the left inlet)
method.digest: Set the value of a specific address in the mvc.remote namespace (on the left inlet).
method.description:
setvalue is a possible method on the left inlet.
The values will be sent to the addresses of the mvc.remote at the specified index (following the setvalue method in MC components).

method.name: address (on the right inlet)
method.digest: Sets the address value of the mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message to monitor.
method.description:
address is a possible method on the right inlet.
The address of a specific mvc.parameter, mvc.state or mvc.message can be given as an OSC formatted symbol. Multiple addresses can be set either as a list or using brace expansion notation or wildcards.

method.name: get (on the right inlet)
method.digest: Retrieve the monitored addresses values or attributes.
method.description:
Possible arguments to the get message are :
get address : output the mvc.remote address (compact/braced form)on the right-most outlet.
get uid : output the mvc.remote's UID (integer) on the right-most outlet.
get values : output the values (on first outlet) and addresses/index (on second outlet) for all addresses of this mvc.remote. If it is followed by an index, only this index will be output.
get addresslist : output the list of addresses on the right-most outlet in the format "addresslist [index] [address]".
get addresscount : output the number of addresses in the namespace of this parameter.
get activeaddresslist : output the list of currently active addresses (that is, for which there exist a corresponding mvc.parameter) on the right-most outlet in the format "addresslist [index] [address]".
get activeaddresscount : output the number of active addresses in the namespace of this parameter.
get attributes : dumpout all attributes on the right-most outlet.
get [attribute] : you can also retrive a specific attribute by specifying its name. For instance the meesage get units will output the units attribute, if any, on the right most outlet.
